meanings.definition: Convert (data or information) into digital form.
meanings.sent1: I will digitalize this paper document by scanning it into my computer.
meanings.sent2: It is important to digitalize important documents for safekeeping.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally digitalized my shopping list instead of printing it out!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a camera, able to digitalize every moment in perfect clarity.
meanings.sent5: The wizard used his magic wand to digitalize the ancient scroll, bringing it to life on the screen.

meanings.sent1: We need to digitalize our record-keeping system for better organization.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to digitalize their entire inventory for easier access.
meanings.sent3: I tried to digitalize my old vinyl records, but they just wouldn't cooperate!
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a computer, able to digitalize complex problems effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The artist used technology to digitalize his paintings, creating stunning digital art pieces.

meanings.sent1: The artist will digitalize his sketches to share them online.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to digitalize photographs for preservation.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally digitalized my recipe book and now I can't cook dinner!
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like files, ready to be digitalized and stored for eternity.
meanings.sent5: The scientist used advanced software to digitalize the DNA sequence, making analysis easier.
